title: Formative Assessment-Based Critical Thinking Task Design: An Activity Theory Approach for Science Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific theories and foundational professional competencies
context.additional_context: Task-centered design integrating formative assessment and critical thinking in BYOD environments. Developing competencies for novice professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to solve scientific problems in real work contexts

learning_goals: Learners can use formative assessment feedback in scientific problem situations to develop task revision plans three or more times.
Learners can design collaborative division-of-labor structures in science problem-solving processes by applying an activity theory framework.
Learners can derive five or more stages of critical thinking through interactions with peers/instructors in extended tasks lasting two weeks or more.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
